metadata.dc:author: Siutti, A J
metadata.dc:description: An isolated paragraph translated from Greek, separated from its previous and following ones, made Darwin believe that Aristotle made a mistake about comprehending teeth formation in life beings, but he pointed out accurately, at the same time, that the philosopher's idea about the aim that rules material changes was, as a precedent to the "natural selection", a dark concept.
metadata.dc:title: Un error que no es de Darwin, sobre la formación de los dientes en la Física de Aristóteles.
[A mistake, not a Darwin's one, about teeth formation in Aristotle's physics].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista del Museo de la Facultad de Odontologia de Buenos Aires
